post_text: Daniel Inouye was a U.S. Senator, and one of the most influential politicians of the 20th Century. He served a President pro tempore of the Senate, making him the highest-ranking Asian-American politician in U.S. history. Inouye graduated from high school immediately following the attack of Pearl Harbor. When the U.S. Army dropped its enlistment ban on Japanese Americans in 1943, Inouye enlisted and volunteered to be part of the segregated all-Neisei-442nd Regimental Combat Team, one of the most decorated units for its size and length of service in American warfare. #APAHM

We are thrilled to celebrate the release of Driven by Data 2.0, an update to the bestselling guide for school leaders, based on the experience of more than 10,000 schools across the globe.

10 years ago, Paul-Bambrick Santoyo, a leader at Uncommon Schools, published Driven by Data, a landmark book that changed the way educators nationwide answer two fundamental questions: How do you know if students are learning? And when they are not, what do you do about it?

Driven by Data 2.0 is a practical guide that answers these questions to empower schools to achieve significant gains in student achievement - and continues Uncommon’s longstanding commitment to sharing what we learn to improve education for all students.

https://www.wiley.com/en-us/Driven+by+Data+2+0%3A+A+Practical+Guide+to+Improve+Instruction-p-9781119524755
